main event: Carl Loar observed a group of shiny, odd-shaped objects moving at high speed through his telescope on December 7, 1950.
interesting points: Loar reported seeing a dozen or more shiny spheres moving at high altitude., The observation was made at about 9:45 p.m. and lasted for approximately 15 minutes., Additional details included objects appearing stationary and then moving rapidly northeast., The sighting is linked to a record card from Project Blue Book with date and location specifics., Neighbors of Loar confirmed the sighting and he reported it to local authorities.
witness description: Carl Loar and his wife Frances observed the objects through a telescope.
